data.chText: （火山）爆发；（岩浆、烟等）喷出
data.enText: when a volcano erupts or burning rocks, smoke, etc. erupt or are erupted , the burning rocks, etc. are thrown out from the volcano

data.chText: 这座火山随时可能爆发。
data.enText: The volcano could erupt at any time.

data.chText: 火山灰开始从火山口喷出。
data.enText: Ash began to erupt from the crater.

data.chText: 大量岩石和熔岩喷发出来。
data.enText: An immense volume of rocks and molten lava was erupted.

data.chText: 突然发生；爆发
data.enText: to start happening, suddenly and violently

data.chText: 大使馆门外突然发生了暴乱。
data.enText: Violence erupted outside the embassy gates.

data.chText: 动乱爆发为革命。
data.enText: The unrest erupted into revolution.

data.chText: 突然发出（尤指叫喊）
data.enText: to suddenly express your feelings very strongly, especially by shouting loudly

data.chText: 我父亲勃然大怒。
data.enText: My father just erupted into fury.

data.chText: 戴维斯第三次得分，观众欢声雷动。
data.enText: When Davis scored for the third time the crowd erupted.

data.chText: 突然（在皮肤上）出现
data.enText: to suddenly appear on your skin

data.chText: 他的胸部突然出满疹子。
data.enText: A rash had erupted all over his chest.

data.chText: 火山大爆发
data.enText: a major volcanic eruption

data.chText: 暴力抗议的爆发
data.enText: an eruption of violent protest

data.chText: 皮疹和疹子
data.enText: skin rashes and eruptions

data.text: explode ♦ blow up ♦ go off ♦ burst ♦ erupt ♦ rupture ♦ implode

data.chText: 以上各词均可表示爆炸、爆破、爆裂。
data.enText: These are all words that can be used when sth bursts apart violently, causing damage or injury.
explode

data.chText: 指爆炸、爆破、爆裂、引爆：
data.enText: to burst loudly and violently, causing damage; to make sth burst in this way

data.chText: 喷气式飞机撞上山坡爆炸了。
data.enText: The jet smashed into a hillside and exploded.

data.chText: 炸弹在受控条件下被引爆了。
data.enText: The bomb was exploded under controlled conditions.
blow (sth) up

data.chText: 指爆炸、（被）炸毁：
data.enText: to be destroyed by an explosion; to destroy sth by an explosion

data.chText: 一名警员在其汽车爆炸时遇难。
data.enText: A police officer was killed when his car blew up.
go off

data.chText: 指炸弹爆炸、枪开火：
data.enText: (of a bomb) to explode; (of a gun) to be fired

data.chText: 炸弹在挤满人的大街上爆炸了。
data.enText: The bomb went off in a crowded street.

data.chText: 用于枪时go off（而非be fired）可表示走火。
data.enText: When used about guns, the choice of go off (not ‘be fired’) can suggest that the gun was fired by accident.
burst

data.chText: 指（使）爆裂、胀开：
data.enText: to break open or apart, especially because of pressure from inside; to make sth break in this way

data.chText: 气球马上要爆了。
data.enText: That balloon's going to burst.
erupt

data.chText: 指火山爆发、（岩浆、烟）喷出
data.enText: (of a volcano) to throw out burning rocks and smoke; (of burning rocks and smoke) to be thrown out of a volcano
rupture

data.chText: 指（使）管道、容器或体内组织破裂、断裂、裂开：
data.enText: ( formal or medical ) to burst or break apart a pipe, container or organ inside the body; to be burst or broken apart

data.chText: 一根水管破裂，漏了满屋子的水。
data.enText: A pipe ruptured, leaking water all over the house.
implode

data.chText: 指向心聚爆、内爆：
data.enText: to burst or explode inwards

data.chText: 房间两边的窗子朝里面爆炸了。
data.enText: The windows on both sides of the room had imploded.
A bomb exploded/blew up/went off/burst.
The car/plane/vehicle exploded/blew up.
A firework/rocket exploded/went off.
A volcano erupted.
A pipe/tank burst/ruptured.
a burst/ruptured appendix/artery

simple_means.memory_skill: e 出 + rupt 破，断裂 → 破裂而喷出 → 爆发

ex.chText: 这座活火山可能在今晚喷发。
ex.enText: This active volcano may erupt tonight.
A fight has erupted outside the restaurant.

synonyms.bx: 多指火山等喷发，也指暴力事件等突然发生。

ex.chText: 工厂的烟囱冒出滚滚浓烟。
ex.enText: Factory chimneys belch out dense smoke.
Fire and smoke belched from the dragon's mouth.

synonyms.bx: 指烟囱等喷出大量烟雾或火焰。

ex.enText: Water spouts from cracks in the stone.

synonyms.bx: 指液体、火焰等喷涌而出。

tr: become active and spew forth lava and rocks
example: Vesuvius erupts once in a while
The crowd irrupted into a burst of patriotism
My skin breaks out when I eat strawberries
After 1989, peace broke out in the former East Bloc
A rash erupted on her arms after she had touched the exotic plant
The tooth erupted and had to be extracted

tr: force out or release suddenly and often violently something pent up
start to burn or burst into flames

value.def: When a volcano erupts, it throws out a lot of hot, melted rock called lava, as well as ash and steam.

example.ex: The volcano erupted in 1980, devastating a large area of Washington state...
example.tran: 那座火山在1980年喷发，摧毁了华盛顿州大片地区。

example.ex: Scientists say Mount Pinatubo could erupt again soon.
example.tran: 科学家说皮纳图博山近期可能会再次喷发。

value.def: If violence or fighting erupts, it suddenly begins or gets worse in an unexpected, violent way.

example.ex: Heavy fighting erupted there today after a two-day ceasefire...
example.tran: 在停火两天后，今天那里爆发了激烈的战斗。

example.ex: Violence erupted as the boys were driven away in two police vans.
example.tran: 两辆警车将男孩们带走时突然发生了暴力冲突。

value.tran: （冲突、战斗等）突然发生，爆发，突然加剧

example.tran: 这次暴力事件的突然发生

value.def: When people in a place suddenly become angry or violent, you can say that they erupt or that the place erupts .

example.ex: In Los Angeles, the neighborhood known as Watts erupted into riots...
example.tran: 在洛杉矶，一个叫做沃茨的街区爆发了动乱。

example.ex: This region which had been relatively calm erupted in violence again this spring.
example.tran: 已经相对平静的这个地区今年春天再次爆发暴力事件。

value.tran: （某地）爆发动乱;（人群）突然暴怒，发生骚乱

value.def: You say that someone erupts when they suddenly have a change in mood, usually becoming quite noisy.

example.ex: Then, without warning, she erupts into laughter...
example.tran: 然后在没有任何征兆的情况下，她突然大笑起来。

example.ex: Newman fled barefoot as the cheated husband erupted in fury.
example.tran: 被戴绿帽的丈夫勃然大怒，纽曼吓得光着脚逃走了。

value.tran: （感情）迸发，突然转变;（常指）变得狂躁

value.def: If your skin erupts, sores or spots suddenly appear there.

example.ex: At the end of the second week, my skin erupted in pimples.
example.tran: 第二周周末，我的皮肤上突然出现了丘疹。

partsOfSpeech.dec: ab 离去 + rupt 破，断裂 → 断开 → 突然断开 → 突然的
bank 银行 + rupt 破，断裂 → 银行倒闭 → 破产的
bankrupt 破产的 + cy 状态 → 破产
cor 加强 + rupt 破，断裂 → 破坏组织肌体 → 腐败的
cor 加强 + rupt 破，断裂 + ion 表状态 → 腐败
dis 加强 + rupt 破，断裂 → 裂开 → 分裂
dis 加强 + rupt 破，断裂 + ion 表名词 → 分裂；瓦解
e 出 + rupt 破，断裂 → 破裂而喷出 → 爆发
e 出 + rupt 破，断裂 + ion 表名词 → 爆发
inter 在…之间 + rupt 破，断裂 → 在〔讲话〕中间打断 → 打断
inter 在…之间 + rupt 破，断裂 + ion，interrupt 的名词 → 打断；插嘴
rupt 破，断裂 + ure 表行为 → 破裂；断绝
ec〔 = e〕出，外 + centric 中心的 → 偏出〔大众〕中心的 → 古怪的
ec 出，外 + type 类型 → 出自原型 → 复制品
ef〔 = e〕出，外 + fabl 讲，说 + e 出，外 → 能说出的
ef 出，外 + femin 女人 + ate 有…性质的 → 出现女人样 → 女性化的
ef 出，外 + ferv 热 + esce 表动作开始 → 开始出热气；〔身体〕发热 → 冒泡；兴奋
ef 出，外 + flu 流 + ence 表行为 → 流出
ef 出，外 + front 前面 + ery 行为 → 抛头露脸 → 厚颜无耻
ef 出，外 + fulg 发光 + ent 具有…性质的 → 发出光 → 光辉灿烂的
ef 出，外 + fus 流 + ive …的 → 流出的；感情奔放的
e 出，外 + ject 扔 → 掷出
e 出，外 + lect 选择 → 选举
e 出，外 + merg 沉，没 + e 出，外 → 水落石出 → 浮现
e 出，外 + migr 迁移 + ate 做，造成，使… → 移居国外
e 出，外 + mit 放出 → 发出
e 出，外 + rupt 断 → 断裂后喷出 → 喷出
e 出，外 + vad 走 + e 出，外 → 走出去 → 逃出
e 出，外 + valu 价值 + ate 使… → 给出价值 → 评价
e 出，外 + vapor 蒸汽 + ate 使… → 使蒸汽出去 → 蒸发
ef〔 = e〕无；除去 + face 脸 → 从脸上去掉 → 擦掉
e 无；除去 + limin 门槛 + ate 做，造成，使… → 从门槛里除去 → 消除
eliminate的名词
e 无；除去 + mascul 雄性 + ate 做，造成，使… → 去男性化 → 阉割
e 无；除去 + radic 根 + ate 做，造成，使… → 除根 → 根除
e 表加强或引申 + labor 工作，劳动 + ate 做，造成，使… → 精细化工作 → 精工细作
e 表加强或引申 + long 长 + ate 做，造成，使… → 延长
e 表加强或引申 + numer 数，计数 + ate 做，造成，使… → 用数表示 → 列举
e 表加强或引申 + special 特别的 → 特别的
e 表加强或引申 + stop 阻止 → 禁止
e 表加强或引申 + strange 陌生 → 使…陌生 → 疏远
e 表加强或引申 + van 空 + ish 使… → 凭空不见 → 消失
